common_issues.title: PiecesOS Bugs and Errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various bugs in PiecesOS, including issues with secret messages, Chrome extension behavior, and update failures.  Suggested workarounds include restarting the application and updating Windows App Installer. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and working on permanent solutions.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** 
* Multiple users reported seeing "basic mode due to device constraints" in PiecesOS, leading to issues with secret messages and, possibly, agent rollups.
* Affected users were running macOS 15.3.1 on M3 Macs.

**Solution:**
* Closing and reopening PiecesOS was suggested as a potential workaround.
* This indicates the issue might be transient or related to the initialization state of the app.

**Current Status:**
* Closing and reopening PiecesOS seems to resolve the issue for most users.
* The root cause of the problem and a permanent fix are yet to be identified.

**Additional Notes:**
* The documentation lacks information about "basic mode due to device constraints."
* More investigation is needed to understand the full scope of the problem and its impact.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* **User:** @ThatRendle reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on Windows.
* **Support Bot:** Provided links to related issues and resources.
* **Pieces Team:** Acknowledged the issue and suggested updating Windows App Installer.
* **User:** @bejokun reported the same issue and mentioned their antivirus detected PiecesOS as a trojan.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS failing to launch on Windows.
* Antivirus detecting PiecesOS as a trojan.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update Windows App Installer.
* Pieces team investigating the antivirus issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with PiecesOS not launching is under investigation.
* The reason for antivirus detection is being investigated.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation happened between March 5th and 10th, 2025.
* The user @ThatRendle hasn't provided further information.
* Other users haven't reported similar issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Personal Domain Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with Pieces OS updates failing to install and difficulties backing up and restoring data using the Personal Domain feature. Proposed solutions include updating Windows App Installer, registering new personal domains, and restoring from cloud backups.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* laborer123 is experiencing two issues: 
    * Unable to change their personal domain after copying com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
    * Unable to back up their current computer using Personal Domain.
* mark-at-pieces clarifies that the personal domain in question is already registered and suggests trying to register a new one.
* mark-at-pieces provides instructions on how to restore a backup and clarifies that it will overwrite all local data with the cloud backup.
* laborer123 clarifies their desire to back up their current computer using Personal Domain and restore it to a new computer.

**Problems Identified:**

* Personal domain cannot be changed after copying com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
* Unable to back up current computer using Personal Domain.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Register a new personal domain.
* Restore a backup from the cloud by clicking the refresh icon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not confirmed if the suggested solutions resolved their issues.
* The user has further questions about backing up their current computer using Personal Domain.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on March 8th and 10th, 2025.
* The user provided screenshots of the issue.
* mark-at-pieces offered assistance and clarification throughout the conversation.
